author: alexp7
title: Proposals Mentors Marketplace -Cont
description: Le marché des mentors de propositions peut-il offrir des mentors qualifiés aux projets catalyseurs financés.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a well set out proposal by a team with good experience in the area to provide a market place for funded proposals to match up wit mentors. The proposers mention two other proposals they are working with, but don't mention another proposal with they are doing in the same challenge with one other which seems very similar . Voters should probably not fund both (https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Easy-Engagement-New-Members-AIM/381856-48088)
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have a detailed plan to build upon a previously funded project which deals with the earlier stage of getting a proposal funded. Given their extensive experience them seem well qualified to deliver this project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a clear delivery timeline to audit progress. They have set out KPI's for measuring success, but unlike their related proposal (Easy Engagement - New Members), they have not put any goals on these KPI's against which success could be measured.

f6_assessments.q0: Currently almost all "mentors" are unofficial and give guidance just for the love of it. It's great if we can preserve that community spirit of peer-to-peer support. This plan solidifies and formalizes the mentoring process to make it more sustainable.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is applying a systematic and agile service design approach to create a good user experience. Preparing solutions in stages/releases is smart. Alex and Philip have proven themselves in Project Catalyst and we can expect great results from them.

As for the payment for the mentor, it's great if the mentor's efforts can be baked in to the proposal budget and if this can be shown with a "seal of mentorship" badge or any standard approach that makes it visible that this particular proposal is being guided by an experienced community mentor. Another way to fund the mentors would be to expand the current "referee reward" to include also mentors.

In that model, all mentors and referees would share the bonus reward and this would mean no extra costs for the treasury.
f6_assessments.q2:
Roadmap and milestones are clear. Metrics measure both progress and outcomes. It's a very well written plan altogether; makes auditing a breeze.

It is notable that the founders/proposers have only reserved 11% of the budget for themselves. This goes to show their character and commitment to create long-term solutions together with others in the community.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposals mentor marketplace proposal continues to address the challenge of looking for mentors to provide guidance to funded projects after the last successfully funded F6 proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: Alex and Phil are well known community members. They both have impressive track records that they can deliver the first MVP within 2 months and the new release 3 months afterwards. The timespan for implementing the proposal is quite brief. The budget will be mainly spent on developing the platform. The proposal KPI should be delved into detail and mapped with their proposal in phase 1 if they achieved the milestones.
f6_assessments.q2: Given the short timespan to deliver the project in phase 2, it could be beneficial for voters to see the impact in 3 months. The proposal could have given more detail but we rely on the crefibility of proposers to deliver the project successfully.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about building out further capacity to the PMM to offer assistance to funded Catalyst Projects. This is a great and meaningful idea. The problem is clearly described, explained in detail, and fits this challenge. The solution is clearly defined showing the clear impact on the Cardano ecosystem in long term. Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly agree with this proposal's impact, I can rate it with a score of 5
f6_assessments.q1: This team consists of active members of the Catalyst, got a proposal funded in the prior fund [F4, F6], with successful products for the community, and their profile shows suitable skill and experiences for implementing this work. This is proof of feasibility from the team profile. The timeline is clear with measurable KPIs. The budget is clear and logical. However, the risk is not defined [or there is no risk foreseen ?]. Therefore, based on the given information, I still agree with this proposal's feasibility, I would rate it with a score of 4
f6_assessments.q2: There is a lot of meaningful information provided, with external links for verification. However, for better transparency, the profile's link of several team members, as well as risk (and mitigation), should be provided [ex: Phil]. After all, based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's auditability, I would rate it with a score of 4

f6_assessments.q0: * In order to accelerate funded projects you need mentors. The problem is well outlined and aligns perfectly with the challenge. The solution and the target group is clear and address the challenge settings. We want to grow the funded projects and help them become investable and profitable ventures. The proposal further develops a previous one and is able to continue and scale in the future.
f6_assessments.q1: The team shows a lot of evidence of professional and social proof via linkedin profiles, short CVs, several previously funded projects, in depth knowledge about Catalyst issues, other proposers and describe how the big picture may look like. The roadmap in months is comprehensive and realistic. It could be a bit more detailed regarding the outcome of each phase and the actions to be done in the defined period of time. The plan describes the resources necessary to implement the proposal. The funding is broken down into understandable packages per role, but could also be a bit more detailed where they come from to justify the fee. The proposer could have included potential challenges and risks to a positive execution.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers explain in detail what is going to happen at what stage. The metrics could be a bit more specified in order to get a better understanding of the impact of the proposal in comparison to other accelerator proposals.

solution: Renforcer la capacité du PMM à offrir une assistance aux projets catalyseurs financés.
experience: Alex et Phil sont des membres actifs de la communauté, des CA et des auteurs de propositions retenues, qui participent à plusieurs initiatives visant à améliorer Catalyst pour tous.
